Dezzie wants to make the web a better place.

As a former front-end dev, Mac Genius, and doctoral student, my work experience has always been about solving people's problems with technology. At the CFPB I have been able to continue advocating for people through planning and moderating UX research, prototyping designs, writing, and helping shape best-practices for a 21st-century government design team. Since I can research, design, and code, I've been known for helping out wherever I can to help something ship on time. To some this makes me a "UX generalist," but I'm pretty sure I'm just a designer.

I wouldn't be a designer if it weren't for having been a die-hard trance music fan since middle school (ask me about that story sometime). But I actively rejected a creative career for ten years after making my first website. I eventually came around to it when I learned that I could use my powers for good. This was when I learned about the CFPB, in a "Surprise!" interview with Audrey Chen (this is also a good story to ask me about).

When not working (but also when working), I like eating, thinking in the abstract, petting my cat Q, and taking stuff apart. I prefer my music without lyrics.

One day I want to write a history of the Internet, or travel to space.

The typeface on my resume is Arquitecta. The typeface on here is Sanchez. Both were created by Latinotype. Their name is a pun on what they do for a living. It is also a pun for what I am doing right now.

©2014 Desirée Zamora García.
My food and my code are always made from scratch.
